text: 14.8 In design terms, an increase in density will not always mean taller buildings are needed or appropriate. Increased density can be achieved in multiple ways, and in many cases a lower-rise form of density may be PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES the more appropriate option, while still providing a significant increase in housing or other uses. However, in other cases, the use of tall buildings may allow for greater density than could otherwise be achieved on smaller or otherwise constrained sites, thus allowing for a greater contribution towards meeting the boroughâ€™s housing needs.
